p: The Peterson Institute states that agricultural production in developing countries will further fall between 10% to 25% and global warming will decrease the agricultural capacity of India by 40% if it continues unabated [ 18]. Hence, climate change causes serious threats to food security [ 6, 19, 20, 21], negative impacts on productivity of different crops, the food supply [ 22, 23], and the cost of adoption of climate change is high [ 24].
